titleStmt.title: House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Resolution
CWG1575

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
In House of Representatives
Thursday, Jan. 7, 1864.

Resolved, That the Governor cause to be fixed, on the 8th day of January 1864, a national salute of 35 rounds in honor of our National victory achieved over the British forces at New Orleans in 1815; and at the same time the Sergeant-at-Arms of this House cause to be unfurled the National flag, with the stars and stripes.

Adopted:
Att: Jas. B. Lyne, Clerk
